name: RomanescoBackyard
description: The Backyard is a place inside a Romanesco installation where multiple things come to life for the first time. It is a curated, centrally maintained collection of resources and translations. It functions as documentation, as living example, as front-end pattern library / style guide and as a playground for trying out new things.
author: Hugo Peek

resources.longtitle: Some ready-made patterns to draw inspiration from and play around with
Practical guides for learning how to perform specific tasks
A sandbox for reproducing and fixing issues or exploring new use cases
Electrons function as a bonding mechanism for atomic systems
Moving up to the level of atoms, things are still very much generic
Molecules are slightly more complex, but they can't function on their own
The outlines of a module appear when dealing with an organism
Templates provide the framework for specific layouts and content types
The end result of all this chemistry is actual website content
Code snippets specially created to solve a particular problem
A set of instructions that fire on certain system events
The invisible force that glues your Romanesco universe together
Convey your message deliberately and with character
resources.description: Focus on: content hierarchy, structuring large amounts of information, tone of voice, connecting to other sources, etc.

resources.longtitle: Create coherent and appealing visual layouts
resources.description: Focus on: content alignment, visually dividing elements, inserting graphics and icons, using galleries and sliders, exploring different layout options, controlling paddings, etc.

resources.longtitle: Make finding the right content fast and effortless
resources.description: Focus on: solving navigational challenges, button usage, call to actions, using overviews, etc.

resources.longtitle: Show visitors that your (organization's) cause is just
resources.description: Focus on: testimonials, homepage hero unit, punchlines in page headers, showcasing portfolio projects, listing clients, etc.

resources.longtitle: Get your knowledge, data and opinions out there
resources.description: Focus on: creating different types of articles, creating a Publications overview page, displaying publication excerpts, writing newsletters, etc.

resources.longtitle: Take on a more graphic approach to tell your story
resources.description: Focus on: tuning it up a notch from basic presentation; full-screen sliders, full-width backgrounds, tiled overviews, snapping images, etc.

resources.longtitle: Convince that what you offer is valuable and important
resources.description: Focus on: working towards a certain action (CTAs), getting better exposure in the first place (SEO), providing social proof (testimonials, ratings, reviews), etc.

resources.longtitle: Get in touch with your audience
resources.description: Focus on: contact information, social media sharing and channels, newsletter subscription, collecting feedback, etc.

resources.longtitle: Stay in touch with your audience
resources.description: Focus on: providing support, building good forms, striking the right tone of voice, using comments, etc.

resources.longtitle: Define how patterns respond to varying environments
resources.description: Focus on: responsive behavior, performance across different devices and internet connections, etc.

resources.longtitle: Convert your efforts and assets into revenue
resources.description: Focus on: ecommerce, pricing tables, marketplace features, etc.

resources.longtitle: Basic contact form
resources.description: NB: Do not edit this form directly! It will be overwritten on the next pattern library update. Duplicate instead.

resources.longtitle: Rules that apply to your entire project
Create crosslinks inside your Romanesco installation
resources.introtext: Create crosslinks inside your Romanesco installation. You can use a crosslink to connect team members to a MODX user ID for example. Or to a portfolio project, so their name and avatar can be shown on the project page.

This group contains all the static files with ContentBlocks settings
resources.description: For better maintenance and reusability, most 'Display=value' type ContentBlocks settings were moved to physical files inside the pattern library. Feel free to add your own or use them in your component, but it's better to leave existing values untouched.
